data.pricing_trends: Winter prices for flights and accommodations typically rise during the holiday season (mid-December to early January) but can be lower in January and February.
data.booking_windows: Optimal booking time is 2-3 months before travel to secure lower prices. Last-minute bookings often have higher rates.

market_insights.pricing_trends: Winter prices for flights and accommodations typically rise during the holiday season (mid-December to early January) but can be lower in January and February.
market_insights.booking_windows: Optimal booking time is 2-3 months before travel to secure lower prices. Last-minute bookings often have higher rates.
market_insights.demand: Demand spikes during the holiday season and again in late February for winter sports enthusiasts.
market_insights.competition: Competitors include destinations like Norway and Finland for winter experiences, yet Iceland offers unique geothermal benefits.

trend_insights.market_trends: Emerging trends include a growing interest in sustainability and eco-friendly travel, with more travelers interested in responsible tourism opportunities in Iceland.
trend_insights.consumer_behavior: Travelers are increasingly looking for packaged experiences that combine adventure, relaxation, and cultural immersion.
trend_insights.competitive_landscape: While other Nordic countries offer winter activities, Iceland's combination of geothermal landscapes and cultural experiences enhances its appeal.
trend_insights.seasonal_factors: Winter conditions can impact availability, with some attractions being seasonal or weather-dependent.
